definition: variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: 16A bolt drawn back and Walter welcomes me.
sentences.chinese: 16门栓拉开了，沃尔特把我让进去。

sentences.english: He stretched himself on her threshold and uttered his complaints to the cruel bolts and bars .
sentences.chinese: 他匍伏在她门槛上对着冷酷无情的插销门栓倾诉哀怨。

sentences.english: Moments later, the bolts of the enormous wooden portal began to move.
sentences.chinese: 过好一会儿，那巨大的木门的门栓开始松动。

sentences.english: The bolt gave way, and the door flung inward to reveal the two gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 门栓脱了位，门向内打开，露出里面的两个家伙。

sentences.english: Rose-Red ran and pulled back the bolt, then flung open the door.
sentences.chinese: 红玫瑰跑到门前把门栓拉开，接着把门打开了。
带贯穿螺栓门栓的加固插销。

sentences.english: Menshuan wolf just pulling up, then opened the door.
sentences.chinese: 狼刚拉起门栓，那门就开了。

definition: horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
bolt (for locking a window, cabinet etc)/(electrical) plug
door knocker (in the shape of a ring)
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
door/the opening panel of a door
